new_issues_to_create.title: Implement comprehensive ARIA labels and keyboard navigation across admin panel
new_issues_to_create.description:
## Problem
Admin panel has critical accessibility gaps that prevent keyboard and screen reader users from using the application:

**Findings from Admin Audit:**
- ACC-001: Only 1 ARIA label found across all admin pages
- ACC-002: Zero keyboard event handlers in admin pages
- ACC-003: Modals don't trap focus or return focus on close
- ACC-004: Bulk selection checkboxes lack accessible labels
- ACC-005: Sortable headers lack aria-sort indicators
- ACC-006: No live region announcements for dynamic updates

## Impact
- Fails WCAG 2.1 Level A compliance (legal risk)
- Screen reader users cannot understand interactive elements
- Keyboard-only users cannot navigate tables, filters, or perform actions
- Estimated ~15% of users affected

## Affected Routes
- `/admin/orders`
- `/admin/products`
- `/admin/users`
- `/admin/analytics`
- `/admin/inventory`

## Affected Components
- `layouts/admin.vue`
- `pages/admin/**/*.vue`
- `components/admin/**/*.vue`

## Recommended Solution
1. Add aria-label/aria-labelledby to all interactive elements
2. Implement keyboard shortcuts (Cmd+K for search, arrow keys for tables, Enter/Escape)
3. Add focus trap using useFocusTrap for modals
4. Add aria-sort to sortable table headers
5. Implement aria-live regions for status updates
6. Add aria-label with context to checkboxes ("Select order #12345")

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All interactive elements have descriptive ARIA labels
- [ ] Keyboard navigation works for tables, filters, modals
- [ ] Focus management in modals (trap and return)
- [ ] Dynamic content announces to screen readers
- [ ] Passes axe DevTools automated scan
- [ ] Manual screen reader testing (NVDA/JAWS)

## Estimated Effort
**High** - 8-10 developer days

## Related Issues
- #126 (Checkout accessibility)
- #123 (Cart accessibility)
- #107 (Product detail accessibility)
- #106 (Product listing accessibility)

new_issues_to_create.title: Create responsive mobile layouts for admin tables (orders, products, users)
new_issues_to_create.description:
## Problem
Admin tables use horizontal scroll on mobile instead of responsive card layout, making them nearly unusable on mobile devices.

**Findings:**
- TABLE-001: Tables use horizontal scroll on mobile (< 768px)
- Mobile admin users must scroll horizontally to see all columns
- Very difficult to perform bulk operations on mobile
- Poor touch target sizes for action buttons

## Impact
- Admin users on mobile (tablets/phones) cannot effectively manage orders/products
- Horizontal scrolling is poor UX pattern for data-heavy tables
- Action buttons too small for touch interaction

## Affected Routes
- `/admin/orders`
- `/admin/products`
- `/admin/users`

## Affected Files
- `pages/admin/orders/index.vue` (lines 115-200)
- `pages/admin/products/index.vue`
- `pages/admin/users/index.vue`

## Recommended Solution
1. Implement responsive card layout for mobile (< 768px)
2. Stack table data in cards with labels for each field
3. Make action buttons larger for touch targets (min 44px)
4. Use slide-out panels for bulk operations on mobile
5. Consider data table component with built-in responsive patterns

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Tables display as cards on mobile (< 768px)
- [ ] All data visible without horizontal scrolling
- [ ] Touch targets meet minimum 44px size
- [ ] Bulk operations accessible on mobile
- [ ] Sorting and filtering work on mobile layout
- [ ] Test on iPhone SE, standard iPhone, iPad

## Estimated Effort
**High** - 6-8 developer days

## Design Reference
- Look at Shopify Admin mobile patterns
- Stripe Dashboard mobile table cards

new_issues_to_create.title: Add search autocomplete with product suggestions and search history
new_issues_to_create.description:
## Problem
Product search shows only basic text input without autocomplete, making product discovery difficult and error-prone.

**Findings from Customer Audit:**
- PROD-001: No autocomplete dropdown
- No recent search history
- No suggested products during typing
- Users struggle with misspellings
- No category suggestions

## Impact
- **Very High** user impact on product discovery
- Difficult to find products with misspellings
- No quick access to previously searched items
- Missing modern e-commerce expectation
- Direct impact on conversion rate

## Affected Routes
- `/products` (main search)
- Header search component

## Affected Files
- `pages/products/index.vue` (lines 109-129)
- `components/layout/AppHeader.vue`

## Recommended Solution
1. Implement autocomplete dropdown component
2. Show top 5 product suggestions as user types
3. Display recent search history (localStorage)
4. Add category suggestions
5. Debounce search input (300ms)
6. Highlight matching text in suggestions
7. Keyboard navigation (arrow keys, enter to select)

## Technical Requirements
- Create `/api/search/suggest` endpoint
- Create `/api/search/history` endpoint for logged-in users
- Use Supabase full-text search
- Store search history in localStorage (guest) and database (logged-in)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Autocomplete shows after 2 characters typed
- [ ] Displays 5 product suggestions with images
- [ ] Shows recent search history (max 10)
- [ ] Category suggestions appear
- [ ] Keyboard navigation works (arrows, enter, escape)
- [ ] Click outside closes dropdown
- [ ] Mobile-optimized bottom sheet on small screens
- [ ] Loading state while fetching suggestions

## Estimated Effort
**High** - 5-7 developer days

## Related Customer Audit Issues
- PROD-002: Mobile filter UX
- NAV-002: Search icon behavior

new_issues_to_create.title: Replace email template JSON textarea with visual form builder

- `/admin/email-templates`

## Affected Files
- `components/admin/Email/TemplateManager.vue` (lines 95-100)
- `pages/admin/email-templates.vue`

## Recommended Solution
**Option A (Recommended):** Visual form builder
1. Replace textarea with structured form fields
2. Add section-based editing (header, body, footer)
3. Visual variable picker for dynamic content

**Option B (Minimum):** Enhanced JSON editor

new_issues_to_create.title: Implement product comparison feature with side-by-side view
new_issues_to_create.description:
## Problem
Users cannot compare multiple products side-by-side to make informed purchasing decisions.

**Findings from Customer Audit:**
- PROD-003: No product comparison feature
- Users must manually remember details or open multiple tabs
- Leads to decision fatigue and abandoned carts
- Missing key e-commerce feature

## Impact
- **Very High** user impact
- Customers cannot easily compare wine varieties, prices, ratings
- Reduced conversion on multi-product consideration
- Competitive disadvantage (most wine shops have this)

## Affected Routes
- `/products` (comparison selection)
- `/compare` (new route for comparison view)

## Recommended Solution
1. Add "Compare" checkbox on product cards
2. Floating comparison bar showing selected products (max 4)
3. Create `/compare` route with side-by-side table
4. Compare attributes:
   - Images
   - Name & Description
   - Price
   - Rating & Reviews
   - Alcohol %
   - Origin/Region
   - Volume
   - Stock status
5. Add to cart from comparison view
6. Share comparison URL

## Technical Requirements
- Store comparison state in localStorage
- Create comparison table component
- Responsive stacked view on mobile
- URL state management: `/compare?products=id1,id2,id3`

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Compare checkbox on product cards
- [ ] Floating comparison bar (max 4 products)
- [ ] Side-by-side comparison table
- [ ] Mobile-optimized stacked view
- [ ] Shareable comparison URL
- [ ] Add to cart from comparison
- [ ] Clear all comparisons button
- [ ] Persist comparison across sessions

## Estimated Effort
**High** - 5-6 developer days

## Related Issues
- #149 (Shop filters enhancement)
- #116 (Product image zoom)

new_issues_to_create.title: Implement persistent wishlist with dedicated page and cross-device sync

new_issues_to_create.title: Add checkout progress indicator showing current step and total steps
new_issues_to_create.description:
## Problem
Users navigate through checkout steps but cannot see overall progress or jump between completed steps.

**Findings from Customer Audit:**
- CHECK-002: No progress indicator
- Users feel lost in checkout
- Uncertain how many steps remain
- Cannot jump to previous steps

## Impact
- High user confusion during checkout
- Perceived long checkout process
- May increase abandonment
- Missing standard checkout UX pattern

## Affected Routes
- `/checkout`
- `/checkout/payment`
- `/checkout/review`
- `/checkout/confirmation`

## Recommended Solution
1. Create checkout stepper component showing:
   - Shipping (1/4)
   - Payment (2/4)
   - Review (3/4)
   - Complete (4/4)
2. Visual indicators:
   - Completed steps: green checkmark
   - Current step: highlighted/active
   - Upcoming steps: gray/inactive
3. Allow clicking on completed steps to edit
4. Mobile-optimized horizontal stepper
5. Progress bar alternative for very small screens

## Technical Requirements
- Track checkout state in Pinia store
- Validate before allowing step navigation
- Persist checkout state in localStorage
- Restore state on page refresh

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Stepper shows on all checkout pages
- [ ] Current step visually highlighted
- [ ] Completed steps show checkmark
- [ ] Click completed steps to edit
- [ ] Prevent skipping ahead
- [ ] Mobile horizontal stepper
- [ ] Accessible with proper ARIA
- [ ] Screen reader announces step changes

## Estimated Effort
**Medium** - 3-4 developer days

## Related Issues
- #126 (Checkout accessibility)
- CHECK-001 (Address autofill)
- CHECK-006 (Review step editing)

new_issues_to_create.title: Add trust badges and security indicators to payment page
new_issues_to_create.description:
## Problem
Payment page lacks SSL indicators, security badges, or payment icons to build user trust during checkout.

**Findings from Customer Audit:**
- CHECK-003: No trust badges or security indicators
- Users may abandon due to security concerns
- Especially impacts first-time buyers
- **Very High** impact on conversion

- Critical conversion blocker
- First-time buyers abandon at payment
- Missing trust signals standard on e-commerce
- Legal/security perception issue

- `/checkout/payment`
- `/checkout/review`

## Affected Files
- `pages/checkout/payment.vue`
- `pages/checkout/review.vue`

## Recommended Solution
1. Add security indicators:
   - SSL padlock icon with "Secure Checkout" badge

3. Trust badges:

## Design Guidelines
- Don't overdo badges (3-4 maximum)
- Use recognizable, standard icons
- Subtle, professional styling
- Mobile-optimized size

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SSL/security badge visible on payment page
- [ ] Payment method logos displayed
- [ ] Trust message near payment form
- [ ] Money-back guarantee badge (if applicable)
- [ ] Mobile-optimized layout
- [ ] Don't clutter the UI
- [ ] Professional, trustworthy appearance

## Estimated Effort
**Low** - 1-2 developer days

- Security badge icons
- Trust badge graphics

## Related Issues
- #126 (Checkout accessibility)
- CHECK-005 (Payment error handling)

new_issues_to_create.title: Add delivery date estimates to cart and checkout
new_issues_to_create.description:
## Problem
Cart and checkout don't show when items will arrive, preventing informed decisions about urgency.

**Findings from Customer Audit:**
- CART-001: No estimated delivery date
- Users can't make informed urgency decisions
- May abandon if they need items by specific date

## Impact
- High - users need delivery info to commit
- Especially important for gift purchases
- Wine orders for events need timing certainty

## Affected Routes
- `/cart`
- `/checkout`

## Affected Files
- `pages/cart.vue`
- `pages/checkout/*.vue`

## Recommended Solution
1. Show delivery estimate for each item in cart:
   - "Estimated delivery: Dec 15-17"
   - Or "Ships in 2-3 business days"
2. Display at checkout with shipping method:
   - Standard: Dec 15-17 (free)
   - Express: Dec 12-13 ($15)
3. Calculate based on:
   - Current date
   - Warehouse location
   - Shipping method
   - Product availability
4. Show overall order delivery estimate

## Technical Requirements
- Create delivery estimation logic
- Consider business days (exclude weekends)
- Handle holidays
- Different estimates per shipping method

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Delivery estimate shows in cart
- [ ] Estimate per shipping method at checkout
- [ ] Accurate business day calculations
- [ ] Consider product availability
- [ ] "Express" vs "Standard" timing clear
- [ ] Mobile-friendly display

## Estimated Effort
**Medium** - 3-4 developer days
